Before discussing the topic of Goat's food in India i.e. Food for goats in India, it is very important to understand that goats can be left to eat grass, leaves etc. in open field too. 
 
 In goat's food, mainly dry grass, sorting, bran, leaves of vegetables, plants and granular food are fed to goats. While choosing food for goat, it is very important to keep in mind that goats do not like rotten street in their food. Following is the list of fibrous food for goats. -eaves of trees like Acacia, Banyan, Tut, Neem Mango, Jackfruit, Peepal, Betun, Bhimal etc. Leaves of bushes like hibiscus, plum, rose karonj, kilmora etc. Leaves or stalks of fenugreek leaves, radish leaves, spinach, mustard, bathua, carrot, turnip, cauliflower etc. 
 
 Acacia and pea leaves are included in the list of leguminous ie succulent leaves The common grass in the list of goat food includes names like Anjan, Senji, Doob, Hirakuri, Motha etc. Grass like corn, jowar, para grass, hybrid napier, lucerne, barseem etc. can be produced for the food of goats. 
 
 Chili of wheat, chili of barley, chili of various pulses can be used as dry grass and straw. 2 Granulated food for goats: Granular food for goats is also easily available in the market, so a person can buy this food from the market as well, but if the goat farmer is a farmer, then with the help of various crops, he can prepare granular food for goats at home as well.
